document.heading: Naming of Public Spaces Amendment Act of 1996

history.narrative: Law 11-236, the “Naming of Public Spaces Amendment Act of 1996,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-565, which was referred to the Committee on Public Works and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 7, 1996, and December 3, 1996, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 24, 1996, it was assigned Act No. 11-496 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-236 became effective on April 9, 1997.
